frame.name: Being_in_control
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Controlling_entity</fen> has control of a <fen>Dependent_entity</fen>, <fen>Dependent_situation</fen>, or <fen>Dependent_variable</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Controlling_entity">She</fex> was <m>in</m> <t>control</t> <fex name="Dependent_entity">of the empire</fex> <fex name="Time">within two days</fex>.</ex>
This frame is distinct from Control in that the <fen>Controlling_entity</fen> is not fully asserted to be currently controlling the <fen>Dependent_entity</fen>, <fen>Dependent_situation</fen>, or <fen>Dependent_variable</fen>, but rather is attentive to it and capable of making the situation correspond to the desired state at any time.</def-root>

FE.name: Controlling_entity
FE.definition: <def-root>A thing or person whose behavior controls a <fen>Dependent_entity</fen>, <fen>Dependent_situation</fen>, or <fen>Dependent_variable</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Dependent_entity
FE.definition: <def-root>An entity, usually a thing, that is influenced in its behavior by a <fen>Controlling_entity</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Dependent_situation
FE.definition: <def-root>A situation whose temporal or other characteristics are influenced by a <fen>Controlling_entity</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Dependent_variable
FE.definition:
<def-root>A scalar variable, whose value depends on the behavior of a <fen>Controlling_entity</fen>.
<ex>Move the slider on the SpeedBar while playing audio or video material to <t>control</t> <fex name="depv">playback speed</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>The location at which the controlling occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of an <fen>Controlling_entity</fen> that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). </def-root>

FE.name: Concessive
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE signifies that the state of affairs expressed by the main clause (containing the target) occurs or holds, and something other than that state of affairs would be expected given the state of affairs in the concessive clause. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: control.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the power to (primarily) determine various features of some entity or situation

lexUnit.name: dominate.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to rule over or control some entity or situation

lexUnit.name: domination.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: authority, rule or control over some entity or situation

lexUnit.name: manage.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to direct, govern, or control in action or use

lexUnit.name: management.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the act of managing; direction or control

lexUnit.name: manipulate.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to skillfully handle, control, or influence something or someone

lexUnit.name: manipulation.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the skillfull handling of, control of, or influence over something or someone

lexUnit.name: rule.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to control, direct, or exercise dominating power or authority over

lexUnit.name: control.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to (primarily) determine various features of some entity or situation
